page.title: 07EDUCATION CREATIVE WRITING
page.content: {SINBAD}(Part 1) by Richard Hobbs Sinbad watched the ship vanish between the sky and the deep blue sea. He walked along, sad, hot and tired. The vegetation seemed to be alive. Bushes were swaying, yet there was no wind. As Sinbad approached the jungle, he heard a rustling sound. Then, as he turned, an arrow creased his shoulder and stuck in a tall tree. He plucked the firmly-placed arrow from its position in the bark. Puzzled, Sinbad turned, only to see that the bush from which the arrow had come had disappeared. He used the arrow as his first spear. He walked cautiously towards a bush that seemed to be moving. As he drew closer, he noticed that the bush had stopped. It rose, revealing an ugly face. Sinbad tried to explain that he was a friend.
